A unique prefix (leave blank if you only have one ElkM1).

The address string must be in the form 'address[:port]' for 'secure' and 'non-secure'. Example: '192.168.1.1'. The port is optional and defaults to 2101 for 'non-secure' and 2601 for 'secure'. For the serial protocol, the address must be in the form 'tty[:baud]'. Example: '/dev/ttyS1'. The baud is optional and defaults to 115200.

Výchozí konfigurace doplňků a ioBrokera se změnila. Pro aktualizaci konfigurace s novými výchozími nastaveními je nutný restart:

- {components}.
component.hassio.issues.issue_system_mul: Could not rename the filesystem. Check the Supervisor logs for more details.

`{reference}` is a filesystem with the name hassos-data and is not the active data disk. This can cause ioBroker to choose the wrong data disk at system reboot.

Use the fix option to rename the filesystem to prevent this. Alternatively you can move the data disk to the drive (overwriting its contents) or remove the drive from the system.
component.hassio.issues.issue_system_reb: Could not reboot the system. Check the Supervisor logs for more details.

Settings were changed which require a system reboot to take effect.

This fix will initiate a system reboot which will make ioBroker and all the Add-ons inaccessible for a brief period.

component.isy994.options.step.init.descr:
Nastavte možnosti pro integraci ISY:
 • Řetězec pro sensory uzlů: S každým zařízením nebo složkou, jejiž název obsahuje tento řetězec, bude zacházeno jako se senzorem nebo binárním senzorem.
 • Ignorovat řetězec: Každé zařízení, jehož jméno obsahuje tento řetězec, bude ignorováno.
 • Proměnný řetězec senzoru: Jakákoli proměnná, která obsahuje "Proměnný řetězec senzoru", bude přidána jako senzor.
 • Obnovit jas světla: Pokud je povoleno, obnoví se předchozí jas při zapnutí světla namísto vestavěného On-Level zařízení.
component.isy994.options.step.init.title: Možnosti ISY994

The Xiaomi Mijia BLE Temperature and Humidity Sensor integration stopped working in ioBroker 2022.7 and was replaced by the Xiaomi BLE integration in the 2022.8 release.

There is no migration path possible, therefore, you have to add your Xiaomi Mijia BLE device using the new integration manually.

Follow the [instructions]({more_info_url}) to configure the Cloud Console:

1. Go to the [OAuth consent screen]({oauth_consent_url}) and configure
1. Go to [Credentials]({oauth_creds_url}) and click **Create Credentials**.
1. From the drop-down list select **OAuth client ID**.
1. Select **Web Application** for the Application Type.
1. Add `{redirect_url}` under *Authorized redirect URI*.

component.nest.config.step.cloud_project: Enter the Cloud Project ID below e.g. *example-project-12345*. See the [Google Cloud Console]({cloud_console_url}) or the documentation for [more info]({more_info_url}).
component.nest.config.step.create_cloud_:
The Nest integration allows you to integrate your Nest Thermostats, Cameras, and Doorbells using the Smart Device Management API. The SDM API **requires a US $5** one time setup fee. See documentation for [more info]({more_info_url}).

1. Go to the [Google Cloud Console]({cloud_console_url}).
1. If this is your first project, click **Create Project** then **New Project**.
1. Give your Cloud Project a Name and then click **Create**.
1. Save the Cloud Project ID e.g. *example-project-12345* as you will need it later
1. Go to API Library for [Smart Device Management API]({sdm_api_url}) and click **Enable**.
1. Go to API Library for [Cloud Pub/Sub API]({pubsub_api_url}) and click **Enable**.

Proceed when your cloud project is set up.
Nest: Create and configure Cloud Project
component.nest.config.step.device_projec:
Create a Nest Device Access project which **requires paying Google a US $5 fee** to set up.
1. Go to the [Device Access Console]({device_access_console_url}), and through the payment flow.
1. Click on **Create project**
1. Give your Device Access project a name and click **Next**.
1. Enter your OAuth Client ID
1. Enable events by clicking **Enable** and **Create project**.

Enter your Device Access Project ID below ([more info]({more_info_url})).
Nest: Create a Device Access Project

Update the Nest Device Access Project with your new OAuth Client ID ([more info]({more_info_url}))
1. Go to the [Device Access Console]({device_access_console_url}).
1. Click the trash icon next to *OAuth Client ID*.
1. Click the `...` overflow menu and *Add Client ID*.
1. Enter your new OAuth Client ID and click **Add**.

Your OAuth Client ID is: `{client_id}`

component.nibe_heatpump.config.step.modb: Unit identification for your Heat Pump. Can usually be left at 0.

Modbus URL that describes the connection to your Heat Pump or MODBUS40 unit. It should be on the form:
 - `tcp://[HOST]:[PORT]` for Modbus TCP connection
 - `serial://[LOCAL DEVICE]` for a local Modbus RTU connection
 - `rfc2217://[HOST]:[PORT]` for a remote telnet based Modbus RTU connection.
component.nibe_heatpump.config.step.nibe: The address of the NibeGW unit. The device should have been configured with a static address.
The local port on this system, that the NibeGW unit is configured to send data to.
The port the NibeGW unit is listening for read requests on.
The port the NibeGW unit is listening for write requests on.

Before attempting to configure the integration, verify that:
 - The NibeGW unit is connected to a heat pump.
 - The MODBUS40 accessory has been enabled in the heat pump configuration.
 - The pump has not gone into an alarm state about missing MODBUS40 accessory.

SimpliSafe authenticates users via its web app. Due to technical limitations, there is a manual step at the end of this process; please ensure that you read the [documentation](http://home-assistant.io/integrations/simplisafe#getting-an-authorization-code) before starting.

When you are ready, click [here]({url}) to open the SimpliSafe web app and input your credentials. If you've already logged into SimpliSafe in your browser, you may want to open a new tab, then copy/paste the above URL into that tab.

When the process is complete, return here and input the authorization code from the `com.simplisafe.mobile` URL.

Please check the configuration for sensor `{entity}` and add suited boundaries, e.g., `sampling_size: 20` to keep the current behavior. The configuration of the statistics integration will become more flexible with version 2022.12.0 and accept either `sampling_size` or `max_age`, or both settings. component.xbox_live.issues.pending_remov:
The Xbox Live integration is pending removal from ioBroker and will no longer be available as of ioBroker 2023.2.

The integration is being removed, because it is only useful for the legacy device Xbox 360 and the upstream API now requires a paid subscription. Newer consoles are supported by the Xbox integration for free.

Remove the Xbox Live YAML configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart ioBroker to fix this issue.

component.zha.options.step.intent_migrat:
Before plugging in your new radio, your old radio needs to be reset.  An automatic backup will be performed.  If you are using a combined Z-Wave and Zigbee adapter like the HUSBZB-1, this will only reset the Zigbee portion.

*Note: if you are migrating from a **ConBee/RaspBee**, make sure it is running firmware `0x26720700` or newer! Otherwise, some devices may not be controllable after migrating until they are power cycled.*

Do you wish to continue?
